name: Suriwongse Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel rooms reek of stale smell, the toilet flush not effective at all, you got to flush it several times. All sorts of noise I guess must be pump working as it appears everytime you uses the tap. The carpet is terribly stained and they don't even provide house slippers! The room that we were given had a curtain that somewhat didn't reaches the floor and you get the glare from the outside which is a busy street. We ask for a double and guess what a double means two single bed pushed together! I now moved to the cafe. The seats are all badly stained. Breakfast is passable. The choice is not too bad just that they are either lukewarm or cold saved for the hot soya milk which is good. The reception service is alright. Overall I strongly advise to stay clear of this hotel.
reviews.title: Avoid at all cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, reception was welcoming until we enquired if an upgrade was possible. We were upgraded, however, in the OLD wing. We stayed in the "suite" which was in poor condition. It was on the topmost floor, we had to take the stairs since the elevator didint go all the way to the top. The bathroom lighting was very dim, the TV remote was broken, We stayed for 3 hours until we saw a lizard. We contacted reception and requested for the room we reserved originally. The receptionist said there were no rooms available, we kept asking until we were shown to the new wing.
reviews.title: Too many negatives during our long stay

reviews.text: We were aware of the new wing but thought since we were upgraded in the old wing that maybe the new wing was still under renovation. What we didint realize is that we had reserved a room in the new orchid wing. We were given a room with two seperate beds. The new room was modern and clean unlike the old one.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Reception should inform guests that the pool is under construction. Also, we were provided with 2 complimentary bottles of water on the 1st night,we consumed 1, The next day, we were provided with just 1, and the third with none since we threw the empty bottles in the trashbin. Strange.....we just purchased our own water.
reviews.title: Pretty grim...

reviews.text: The bathroom sinks,floors and doors were not clean and some appliances did not work
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in April,We booked this hotel for location and the location was fantastic..
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic rooms

reviews.text: WE were picked up from the hotel with the private taxi service at 180bhat per person and the driver was at Chiang mai int airport with my name on a board(great start) a fantastic air con bus for 5 adults and 5 big Suitcases.
reviews.title: exelent, choice location, very very helpful staff,room clean good water ect

reviews.text: We were checked in at the new recepition of the hotel and greeted with a fantastic Thai smile...We were then shown to our two rooms Orchid deluxe rooms in the new wing on level 7..Fantastic upgraded rooms with amazing space with a ultra large double bed and massive three seater sofa and two chairs and table..The bathroom had a sunken bath and its own private shower with the other bits and bobs..The breakfast was ok but you could fill your self up for the day ahead..
reviews.title: Large rooms, great for families - great location

reviews.text: The swimming pool was closed at the hotel but they give us a ticket to use at the ECO LODGE fantastic swimming pool with free transfers if not a tuk tuk was 100baht so not bad at all.
reviews.title: Lots of negative points but nice location and budget.

reviews.text: The travel agent on site was great with the trips and we booked the flying with the gibbions ...Now that was fantastic.
reviews.title: the heart of the chiang mai city Unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one week at the Suriwongse hotel in January. We stayed there several times previously, the last time being four years ago. I thought then the hotel was starting to look shabby but without checking further, assumed there had been renovatiions. WAS I WRONG. The upholstered furniture that bothered us the most were the dining room chairs - literally covered with stains. It was so bad that although the breakfast buffet was varied and very good, we ate very little thinking of the condition of the kitchen.
reviews.title: Upholstered furniture covered with stains

reviews.text: The location is one of the best in Chiang Mai - Right next door to the Night Market, walking distance to the Sunday Market, lots of massages, food, laundry shops and many tuk2, and taxis passing. The Orchid Room is very spacious with full toiletries. The room, despite being a smoking room, smelled nice. Another good thing is the window can be opened wide.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Great Value for Money

reviews.text: Service was good. Our request for extra blanket was met with no hesitance.
reviews.title: Full of Potential, but Really Just Average

reviews.text: The hotel is pretty old though. The way to the lobby was isolated and depressing. However, our room was newly renovated.
reviews.title: Very good!

reviews.text: The other negative thing for the room is the information that the sofa in the Orchid Deluxe Room is a sofa bed but in actual fact it is a mere sofa (but comfortable though). The bed was slightly too hard for my taste.
reviews.title: clean and spacious

reviews.text: Our room faces the back with no view whatsoever. We also had some problem with the hot water supply.
reviews.title: Old Wing but good clean rooms

description: Suriwongse Hotel Chiang Mai is perfectly located on the corner of Loikoh and Changklan Road, right at the heart of Chiang Mai’s landmark the “Night Bazaar”. The hotel is a short distance from Chiang Mai International Airport, the railway and bus stations.Conveniently located in the heart of the ancient city, The Suriwongse Hotel Chiang Mai is perfect for leisure and business travellers alike. The hotel is close to the city’s main business district and many of the major attractions are within walking distance. And when the evening comes, you are just a few steps away from the famous Night Bazaar, where you can enjoy a lively blend of shopping and entertainment. The hotel is only a ten-minute drive from Chiang Mai’s International Airport, and within easy reach of the city’s outskirts if you want to get away for a round of golf or to enjoy a day trip in the hills.A few steps from the famous Night Bazaar, the hotel is perfectly located for exploring Chiang Mai’s many cultural sights and attractions. The Suriwongse Hotel Chiang Mai caters to cultural adventure seekers embraced by the warmth of local treat combined with quality service. Its contemporary interior blends in perfect harmony with the traditional Thai Lanna style architecture, creating a warm ambience. In a buzzing and vibrant atmosphere, we present exciting dining options with inter-active show kitchens.The traditional influences of the north’s ancient Lanna Kingdom are incorporated into the decor of each of our rooms and suites. Suriwongse Hotel Chiang Mai’s rooms and suites, enjoy either restful views of the city center or look out over the majestic misty mountain of Doi Suthep. While inside, a range of modern amenities create a haven of comfort where weary travellers can rest and recharge.
